did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Jinx Beers was founder of Lesbian News and lifelong lesbian activist throughout Southern California. This collection represents administrative activities of Lesbian News as well as the writing and publication of Beers's memoir and various stories and articles.
did.physloc: Stored off-site at SRLF. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. Please contact UCLA Library Special Collections for paging information.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. Please contact UCLA Library Special Collections for paging information.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical object belong to the UC Regents. Literary rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Jinx Beers papers, (Collection 2222). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were donated by Baylis Glascock.
This collection is part of an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW) and the UCLA Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA is an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW) and the UCLA Library. These collections expand the pool of primary source materials available to researchers and to the community at large. This partnership was initiated by CSW and is funded by the National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) to inventory, organize, preserve, and digitize more than eighty Mazer collections pertaining to lesbian and feminist activism and writings.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Jinx Beers was born in Pasadena, CA in 1933. She joined the Air Force and after receiving an honorable discharge, she remained active in Reserves for another twelve years. She resigned in 1974 due to the United States Military's policies concerning homosexuals. She then went on to earn a Bachelor of Arts degree from the University of California Los Angeles in experimental psychology. She worked at the UCLA Institute for Transportation and Traffic Engineering for eighteen years.

In 1973, Beers co-taught the first lesbian studies class at the Experimental College at the University of California Los Angeles, which served as a connecting point for many Los Angeles activists and yielded a group called Lesbian Activists.

In 1975, Beers founded The LN (The Lesbian News), a publication of lesbian news that is still active and published monthly. After fourteen years as the editor and owner of The LN, Jinx Beers sold the periodical and begin publishing LSF: Lesbian Short Fiction. She also managed the business of artist and partner Alicia Austin.

2008 saw the publication of her memoir, Memoirs of an Old Dyke and in 2009, she was honored with a proclamation by the City of West Hollywood as well as with an Etheridge Award for her service to the community.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection includes Beers's personal materials including research and preparatory work for her memoir Memoirs of an Old Dyke as well as administrative materials for the magazine, Lesbian News.
Correspondence related to the operations and subscriptions of the Lesbian News.
Correspondence related to the operations and subscriptions of the Lesbian News.
Correspondence related to the operations and subscriptions of the Lesbian News.
Correspondence related to the operations and subscriptions of the Lesbian News.
Correspondence related to the operations and subscriptions of the Lesbian News.
Correspondence related to the operations and subscriptions of the Lesbian News.
Correspondence related to the operations and subscriptions of the Lesbian News.
Correspondence related to the operations and subscriptions of the Lesbian News.
Correspondence related to the operations and subscriptions of the Lesbian News.
Correspondence related to the operations and subscriptions of the Lesbian News.
Correspondence having to do with Lesbian News. Includes correspondence from advertisers, subscribers and readers.
Correspondence having to do with the Lesbian News, includes correspondence from advertisers, subscribers and additional readers.
Includes agreements, correspondence, promissory notes, security agreement and bill of sale pertaining to the sale of the Lesbian News from Jinx Beers to Deborah Bergman.
Includes four issues of The Lesbian News: September 1989, August 1997, February and April 2005.
Includes: The Lesbian: Coworker, Wife and Mother That Western Sidewinder! Stop, Mother: Don't Deny Your Youngster a Pet Snake! Beauty Away from the Crowds: Lava Bed National Monument
Includes: To Fly with Eagles No Turning Back Leonard The Election Everything is a Matter of Timing The Patchwork Dragon The Mouse The Best Laid Schemes The Amazing Miss Manody
Manuscript for Jan, a novella by Jinx Beers. Also includes correspondence with NAIAD Press.
Poems by Jinx Beers.

did.unittitle: Memoirs of an Old Dyke - Advertisements.

scopecontent.p: Documents relating to advertising for Jinx Beers's memoirs.

did.unittitle: Memoirs of an Old Dyke - Review Information.

scopecontent.p: Copies of or notices of reviews of Memoirs of an Old Dyke.
Emails, correspondence and other information concerning radio interviews with Jinx Beers.
Copies of orders for Memoirs of an Old Dyke.
Handwritten notes, copyright information and other research materials for self publishing.
Correspondence with advertisers and promoters concerning Memoirs of an Old Dyke.

did.unittitle: Memoirs of an Old Dyke - Correction Process.

scopecontent.p: Contains documentation of the correction process for Jinx Beers's memoir.

did.unittitle: Memoirs of an Old Dyke - Final Draft (submitted to publisher).

scopecontent.p: Final draft of Jinx Beers's memoir, later submitted to publisher.

did.unittitle: Memoirs of an Old Dyke - Proof.

scopecontent.p: A photocopied copy of the proof of Jinx Beers's memoir, includes visuals.

did.unittitle: Memoirs of an Old Dyke - Correspondence and Email.

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, print outs of email concerning the publication, editing process and marketing of Jinx Beers's memoir.

did.unittitle: Memoirs of an Old Dyke - Photographs.

scopecontent.p: Photographs used for Jinx Beers's memoir.

did.physdesc: printed paper, post it notes, handwritten notes

scopecontent.p: Correspondence about the breakup of Alicia Austin and Jinx Beers. Includes correspondence between Alicia and Jinx as well as between friends in reference to the details and fallout of their breakup.
Correspondence between Jinx Beers and three friends, Kathy, Gail and Alan.
Miscellaneous correspondence, both professional and personal of Jinx Beers.
Correspondence concerning the awards and interviews of Jinx Beers.
Correspondence between Jinx Beers and her friend Virginia.
Paperwork for the nomination of the Rainbow Key Award, an award given by the city of West Hollywood, California for outstanding contributions to the gay and lesbian community.
Correspondence concerning the deposit of the Jinx Beers Papers to the June L. Mazer Archives.
Correspondence having to do with Jinx Beers's professional life.
Notes on volume assembled by Jinx Beers in preparation to donate her collection to the June L. Mazer Archives. Each folder has retained its original label.
Photographs from Jinx Beers's adult life.
Photographs of Jinx with lovers over the years.
Jinx Beers was the cover story for this issue of FRONTIERS magazine.
Includes the Lesbian of the Year Award (homemade), Dick Michaels Media Awards and a Novel Writing Workshop Certificate.
Crosstitched homemade cards by Sister Virginia.
Several issues of the "Ransom Notes"
Crosstiched homemade cards by Sister Virginia.

did.unittitle: Nobody Loves you Like a Sister.

scopecontent.p: Published book through New Leaf Press.
Crosstitched homemade cards by Sister Virginia.

Contains framed personal notes as well as three diplomas: CCC Management Team Recognizes Jinx Beers for United States Military Service on Veteran's Day 2002 Certificate of Achievement from the Los Angeles Department of Water and Power for completing a course in Basic Customer Service Procedures 1999 Bachelor of Arts Diploma with a Major in Psychology from the University of California 1963 CCC Star Hitter for Perfect Attendance 2004
